trans-unit.source: Defines a structure that represents the style of a font face as normal, italic, or oblique.
Three terms categorize the slant of a font: normal, italic, and oblique.
Font style
Description
Normal
The characters in a normal, or roman, font are upright.
Italic
The characters in an italic font are truly slanted and appear as they were designed.
Oblique
The characters in an oblique font are artificially slanted.
The slant is achieved by performing a shear transformation on the characters from a normal font.
When a true italic font is not available on a computer or printer, an oblique style can generated from the normal font and used to simulate an italic font.
You can use the enumerated values of the <xref:System.Windows.FontStyles> class to set the <xref:System.Windows.FontStyle> structure.
XAML Attribute Usage
XAML Values
*fontStylesValue*
A <xref:System.Windows.FontStyles> value, such as "Normal", "Italic", or "Oblique".
Compares an <xref href="System.Object"></xref> with the current <xref href="System.Windows.FontStyle"></xref> instance for equality.
An <xref href="System.Object"></xref> value that represents the <xref href="System.Windows.FontStyle"></xref> to compare for equality.
`true` to show the two instances are equal; otherwise, `false`.
Compares a <xref href="System.Windows.FontStyle"></xref> with the current <xref href="System.Windows.FontStyle"></xref> instance for equality.
An instance of <xref href="System.Windows.FontStyle"></xref> to compare for equality.
`true` to show the two instances are equal; otherwise, `false`.
Retrieves the hash code for this object.
The returned value serves as a hash function for a particular type, suitable for use in hashing algorithms and data structures like a hash table.
A 32-bit hash code, which is a signed integer.
Compares two instances of <xref href="System.Windows.FontStyle"></xref> for equality.
The first instance of <xref href="System.Windows.FontStyle"></xref> to compare.
The second instance of <xref href="System.Windows.FontStyle"></xref> to compare.
`true` to show the specified <xref href="System.Windows.FontStyle"></xref> objects are equal; otherwise, `false`.
Evaluates two instances of <xref href="System.Windows.FontStyle"></xref> to determine inequality.
The first instance of <xref href="System.Windows.FontStyle"></xref> to compare.
The second instance of <xref href="System.Windows.FontStyle"></xref> to compare.
`false` to show left is equal to right; otherwise, `true`.

Creates a <xref href="System.String"></xref> that represents the current <xref href="System.Windows.FontStyle"></xref> object and is based on the <xref href="System.Globalization.CultureInfo.CurrentCulture"></xref> property information.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> that represents the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.FontStyle"></xref> object, such as "Normal", "Italic", or "Oblique".
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.IFormattable.ToString(System.String,System.IFormatProvider)"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.String"></xref> specifying the format to use.
-or-
`null` to use the default format defined for the type of the <xref href="System.IFormattable"></xref> implementation.
The <xref href="System.IFormatProvider"></xref> to use to format the value.
-or-
`null` to obtain the numeric format information from the current locale setting of the operating system.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> containing the value of the current instance in the specified format.
